The "Structural diagram" dashboard
The analytical panel of the "Structural diagram"
dashboard
allows users to create charts based on data dependency. All displayed values are borrowed from the configured
data source
.
The structural diagram can be shown as follows:
While editing the dashboard visual, drag and drop the "Structural diagram" element from the "Elements" panel onto the workspace.
Further configuration of the diagram is performed by clicking the
button. Clicking this button opens the modal window, which contains five tabs.
Setting parameters
Basic settings
In the "Base" tab, specify the main dashboard parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering/displaying the chart name. This name will be displayed to the end user in the profile.
Data source
Defining the data source based on which the diagram will be created.
Chart type
Defining the chart type. Possible values (described below):
• Donut
• Pie
• Bar
• Horizontal bar
• Funnel
• Bubble
Column to group
Selecting an attribute which value will be used to group data.
The parameter is displayed when configuring all charts types except "Bubble".
Column to aggregate value
Selecting an attribute whose value will be used for value aggregation.
The parameter is displayed when configuring all charts types except "Bubble".
Number of data series
Defining the number of displayed data series.
Selection is performed via a toggle switch, possible values:
One
More than one.
By default, the value "One" is set
.
The parameter is displayed when configuring "Column" or "Horizontal Column" type charts.
Column for series name
Selecting the data source field whose value will be used as the name of grouped data.
The parameter is displayed when configuring "Column" or "Horizontal Column" type charts, when the number of data series is specified as "More than one".
Column to aggregate value
Selecting  the attribute whose value will be used for value aggregation.
The parameter is displayed when configuring all charts types except "Bubble".
Aggregation method
Selecting the aggregation method.
Possible values:
• Quantity
• Maximum
• Minimum
• Weighted average
• Average
The parameter is displayed when configuring all charts types except "Bubble".
Column for radius
Selecting an attribute whose value will be used to calculate the radius of the bubble chart item ("bubble").
Column for the X axis
Selecting an attribute whose value will be used to define the abscissa axis.
Column for the Y axis
Selecting an attribute whose value will be used to define the ordinate axis.
Column for caption
Selecting an attribute whose value will be used for captions on the bubble chart ("bubbles").
Show captions on the chart
Defining whether there are captions on the bubble chart.
Decoding the sector of the diagram
Column with sector identifier
Parameter required for creating series value breakdown (Drill-down).
Show table with details
Opening an explanatory table with data when clicking on a chart sector.
Dashboard table with details
Selecting the dashboard table that will be displayed when clicking on a dynamics chart sector. The field is displayed when the "Show breakdown table" toggle is active.
Set the Dashboard parameter values when decoding
Defining values for dashboard parameters during decoding. The ability to set parameter values is available when the toggle is active.
Clicking the button displays fields for adding dashboard parameter values.
The button is displayed when the "Set the Dashboard parameter values when decoding" parameter toggle is active.
Dashboard parameters
Selecting a dashboard parameter to set the value.
The field is displayed after clicking the add parameter button.
Dashboard parameter values
Selection of the dashboard parameter value. Possible values:
Diagram sector identifier;
Constant.
By default, the value "Diagram sector identifier" is used.
The field is displayed after clicking the add parameter button.
Configuring the design style, filtering and additional settings are done similarly to the
Dynamics chart
dashboard element.
Style settings
On the "Style of design" tab, the user can set the chart size and color scheme.
The following design parameters can be configured on this tab:
Setting
Purpose
Chart height, %
Setting the chart height and width. If needed, the "Maintain aspect ratio" option can be used by clicking the
button.
By default, the following parameters are set: chart height - 100%, chart width - 40%.
Chart width, %
Palette
Selecting a
palette
for the chart color style.
The selection is made from a dropdown list of standard or previously created palettes. The user can create a new palette or edit the selected one via the parameter action menu.
By default, the GreenData corporate color palette is set.
Palette color cyclicity
Enabling the cyclic repetition of palette colors for the chart.
If colors in the declared palette are exhausted, then with cyclicity disabled, colors from the system palette will be used.
Enabled by default.
Accumulation chart
Method of presenting chart series for visual data comparison.
Parameters are displayed when configuring "Column" or "Horizontal Column" type charts.
Grouping chart
Group spacing
Setting the interval between series groups.
Configuration is performed by moving sliders or entering a numerical value from 0 to 100.
The parameter is displayed when configuring "Column" or "Horizontal Column" type diagrams.
Column spacing
Setting the interval between columns of series groups.
Configuration is performed by moving sliders or entering a numerical value from 0 to 100.
The parameter is displayed when configuring "Column" or "Horizontal Column" type diagrams, when the "Grouping chart" presentation method is selected.
Additional settings
The configuration on the "Additional" tab allows adding JSON code with additional options, which will be displayed on the chart after saving.
Currently, JSON expressions are not used to configure dashboard elements.
Filter settings
On the "Filter" tab, additional data filtering can be set.
After clicking the add filter button, a field for selecting the column whose data will be filtered is displayed.
Using the add filter condition button, parameter pairs are configured where the equality condition ("Equal", "Not equal", "Less than", "Greater than", "Less than or equal", "Greater than or equal") and value must be specified.
When multiple filter conditions are present, the AND/OR switch regulates the relationship between the specified conditions.
Sorting
This tab configures data sorting on the diagram.
The tab is unavailable when configuring a structural diagram of the "Bubble" type.
Setting
Purpose
Sort column
Selecting the column by which data sorting will be performed.
Selection is made from a dropdown list containing columns previously selected on the
"Base"
tab in the "Column to aggregate value" and "Column to group" parameters.
The column selected in the "Grouping column" parameter is used as the default sorting.
Sort type
Selecting the sorting direction (ascending or descending).
By default, sorting is performed in ascending order.
If two conditions are present, the sorting order can be changed using the Drag&Drop method via the
icon.
Decryption
On this tab, the relationship between two or more analytical panels is configured. In other words, this setting allows real-time changes to the display of data in one analytical panel depending on the selected value of another analytical panel.
For more information on decryption configuration, refer to
Data Drill Down Decryption
.
Result
After the configuration of the flow chart is complete, the user can save it in a required format and print it out.
